task_summary: The robot is tasked with picking up a white disk from a shelf, demonstrating a basic pick operation involving perception, approach, grasp, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A blue/white robot arm is situated in a kitchen/lab space and must pick up a white disk object placed on a black shelf. The sequence involves perceiving the disk, approaching it, aligning above, computing a grasp, executing the grasp, verifying contrived success, and retreating post-grasp. This follows standard manipulation and perception constraints for tabletop pick-and-place tasks.
preconditions: The disk is present and accessible on the shelf.
Robot arm is functional and gripper is open.
No obstructions between the robot and disk.
stepwise_plan: Check if disk is visible; if not, attempt detection.
Open gripper to the required width.
Move above the disk at a defined vertical offset.
Approach and align carefully using a set tolerance.
Compute a top grasp pose for the disk.
Execute grasp at the computed pose with selected strategy.
Verify disk is secured in gripper.
Retreat from shelf with disk in gripper.
success_criteria: Disk grasp pose is computed successfully.
Gripper securely holds the disk (ObjectInGripper condition met).
Robot has retreated with disk in gripper.
failure_and_recovery: Grasp unsuccessful: re-approach and compute grasp again.
Object not in gripper: abort or re-attempt grasp.
task_long_description.termination: Task terminates upon successful retreat with disk grasped or unrecoverable failure.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if disk is in robot's field of view.
Runs visual sensor routines to localize the disk.
Fine-tunes position to align with disk within 5mm tolerance.
Computes grasp pose for disk using top strategy, stores as std_top.
Executes grasp at computed pose using top grasp.
Verifies disk is secured in gripper.
Moves gripper away from shelf by 10cm after grasp occurs.

failure_modes: Disk localization failed due to poor lighting.
Grasp pose computation fails or is inaccurate.
Grasp execution fails (misses or slips disk).
recovery_strategy: Fallback to DetectObject if IsObjectVisible fails.
Abort and re-initiate approach or grasp if verification fails.
Recompute pose and re-grasp if ObjectInGripper returns false.
assumptions: Instruction 'pick the disk' matches visual evidence; object in scene is a disk on shelf.
No place or transfer action needed as per frames; focus is solely on pick and retreat.
Object referred to as 'disk' per annotation, ignoring minor shape ambiguity.
No forced fast/slow grasp in instruction; all timers binned by visual tempo in sequence.

expected_success_criteria: Robot arm picks up disk from shelf, verified by ObjectInGripper and retreat phase.
